content:
Sure, here are some websites that offer free resources for scaffold writing:

1. Teachers Pay Teachers: This website has a wide range of free and paid resources, including worksheets, activities, and lesson plans created by teachers for teachers.
2. Pinterest: This website has a wealth of free resources, including educational posters, worksheets, and activities that can be used to support scaffold writing.
3. Scholastic: This website offers a wide range of free resources, including lesson plans, worksheets, and activities for different grade levels.
4. The National Writing Project: This website offers resources and professional development opportunities for teachers to improve their instruction of writing.
5. The Literacy Trust: This website offers a wide range of free resources and information to help support children's literacy development, including writing resources.
6. ReadWriteThink : This website offers a collection of free resources for teachers and students. It includes interactive tools, printouts, and lesson plans for writing instruction.
7. Education.com : This website offers a collection of free resources for teachers and parents, including worksheets, activities, and lesson plans for various subjects, including writing.

These are just a few examples, there are many more resources available online, and it's always good to explore and find the resources that work best for you and your students.
